original: Dīgha Nikāya 19
analyzed: dīgha nikāya
translated: Long Discourses

original: Mahāgovindasutta
analyzed: mahāgovindasutta
translated: With Mahāgovinda

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha on the Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: Atha kho pañcasikho gandhabbaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṁ
analyzed: atha kho pañcasikhaḥ gandhabba puttaḥ abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta vaṇṇaḥ kevala kappa
translated: Then, when the night was well advanced, Pañcasikha the gandhabba, his body radiant, illuminating the whole of Vultures’ Peak,

original: gijjhakūṭaṁ pabbataṁ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ
analyzed: gijjhakūṭam pabbatam obhāsetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavanta
translated: came to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side.

original: abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho pañcasikho gandhabbaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho pañcasikhaḥ gandhabba puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Pañcasikha said to the Buddha,

original: “yaṁ kho me, bhante, devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ sammukhā sutaṁ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ, ārocemi taṁ bhagavato”ti.
analyzed: yam kho me bhante devānam tāvati sānam sammukhā sutam sammukhā paṭiggahitaḥ ārocemi tam bhagavatā iti
translated: “Venerable Sir, I would like to tell you what I heard and learned from the Thirty-Three Gods.”

original: “Ārocehi me tvaṁ, pañcasikhā”ti bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: ārocehi me tva pañcasikhāti bhagavān avoca
translated: “Tell me, Pañcasikha,” said the Buddha.

original: 1. Devasabhā
analyzed: deva sabhā
translated: . The Assembly Hall of the Gods

original: “Purimāni, bhante, divasāni purimatarāni tadahuposathe pannarase pavāraṇāya puṇṇāya
analyzed: purimāni bhante divasāni purimatarāni tad aha uposathe panna rase pavāraṇāya puṇṇāya
translated: “Venerable Sir, a few days ago, on the Uposatha day of the fifteenth, the full moon of the fifteenth,

original: puṇṇamāya rattiyā kevalakappā ca devā tāvatiṁsā sudhammāyaṁ sabhāyaṁ sannisinnā honti sannipatitā;
analyzed: puṇṇamāya rattiyā kevalakappā ca devā tāvatisā sudhammāyam sabhāyam sannisinnā honti sannipatitā
translated: On the night of the full moon, the gods of the Thirty-three are seated together in the Sudhamma Assembly,

original: mahatī ca dibbaparisā samantato nisinnā honti, cattāro ca mahārājāno catuddisā nisinnā honti;
analyzed: mahatī ca dibba parisā samantataḥ nisinnāḥ honti cattāro ca mahārājāno catuddisā nisinnāḥ honti
translated: and the great assembly of gods is seated all around. The Four Great Kings are seated in the four directions,

original: puratthimāya disāya dhataraṭṭho mahārājā pacchimābhimukho nisinno hoti deve purakkhatvā;🔽dakkhiṇāya disāya virūḷhako mahārājā uttarābhimukho nisinno hoti deve purakkhatvā;
analyzed: puratthimāya disāya dhataraṭṭhaḥ mahā rājā pacchima abhimukhaḥ nisinnaḥ hoti deve purakkhatvā  dakkhiṇāya disāya virūḍhakaḥ mahā rājā uttara abhimukhaḥ nisinnaḥ hoti deve purakkhatvā
translated: in the east the Great King Dhataraṭṭha is seated facing west with his gods,🔽in the south the Great King Virūḷha is seated facing north with his gods,

original: pacchimāya disāya virūpakkho mahārājā puratthābhimukho nisinno hoti deve purakkhatvā;
analyzed: pacchimāya disāya virūpakkhaḥ mahā rājā purattha abhimukhaḥ nisinnaḥ hoti deve purakkhatvā
translated: in the west the Great King Virūpakkha is seated facing east with his gods,

original: uttarāya disāya vessavaṇo mahārājā dakkhiṇābhimukho nisinno hoti deve purakkhatvā.
analyzed: uttarāya disāya vessavaṇaḥ mahā rājā dakkhiṇa abhimukhaḥ nisinnaḥ hoti deve purakkhatvā
translated: and in the north the Great King Vessavaṇa is seated facing south with his gods.

original: Yadā, bhante, kevalakappā ca devā tāvatiṁsā sudhammāyaṁ sabhāyaṁ sannisinnā honti
analyzed: yadā bhante kevalakappā ca devā tāvatisā sudhammāyam sabhāyam sannisinnāḥ honti
translated: When the gods of the Thirty-three are seated together in the Sudhamma Assembly,

original: sannipatitā, mahatī ca dibbaparisā samantato nisinnā honti, cattāro ca mahārājāno
analyzed: sannipatitā mahatī ca dibba parisā samantataḥ nisinnāḥ honti cattāro ca mahā rājāno
translated: and the great assembly of gods is seated all around, and the Four Great Kings

original: catuddisā nisinnā honti, idaṁ nesaṁ hoti āsanasmiṁ;
analyzed: catuddisā nisinnāḥ honti idam hoti āsanasmi
translated: They sit in the four directions, and that is their seat.

original: atha pacchā amhākaṁ āsanaṁ hoti.🔽Ye te, bhante, devā bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā adhunūpapannā tāvatiṁsakāyaṁ, te aññe deve atirocanti vaṇṇena ceva yasasā ca.
analyzed: atha pacchā amhākam āsanam hoti  ye te bhante devāḥ bhagavati brahmacariyam caritvā adhunā upapannā tāvatisakāya te aññe deve atirocanti vaṇṇena ca iva yasasā ca
translated: But we have to sit afterwards.🔽Those gods who have practiced the spiritual life under the Buddha and have recently been reborn in the Tavatimsa realm surpass the other gods in both beauty and glory.

original: Tena sudaṁ, bhante, devā tāvatiṁsā attamanā honti pamuditā pītisomanassajātā;
analyzed: tena suda bhante devā tāvatisāḥ attamanāḥ honti pamuditā pīti somanassa jātā
translated: The Thirty-Three Gods are uplifted and filled with joy and happiness,

original: ‘dibbā vata bho kāyā paripūrenti, hāyanti asurakāyā’ti.
analyzed: dibbā vata bho kāyā paripūrenti hāyanti asura kāyā ati
translated: thinking, ‘The divine hosts are growing, while the asura hosts are declining.’

original: Atha kho, bhante, sakko devānamindo devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ sampasādaṁ viditvā imāhi gāthāhi anumodi:
analyzed: atha kho bhante sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ devānam tāvati sānam sampasādam viditvā imāhi gāthāhi anumodi
translated: Then Sakka, having recognized the delight of the Thirty-Three Gods, expressed his appreciation with these verses:

original: ‘Modanti vata bho devā,
analyzed: modanti vata bho devā
translated: ‘The gods rejoice,

original: tāvatiṁsā sahindakā;
analyzed: tāvatī sā sahindakā
translated: the Thirty-Three with their lord,

original: Tathāgataṁ namassantā,
analyzed: tathāgatam namassantā
translated: Paying homage to the Buddha,

original: dhammassa ca sudhammataṁ.
analyzed: dhammassa ca su dhammata
translated: and to the Dhamma’s excellence.

original: Nave deve ca passantā,
analyzed: nave deve ca passantā
translated: Seeing the new gods,

original: vaṇṇavante yasassine;
analyzed: vaṇṇavante yasassine
translated: beautiful and glorious,

original: Sugatasmiṁ brahmacariyaṁ,
analyzed: sugatasmin
translated: Who have practiced the spiritual life under the Buddha,

original: caritvāna idhāgate.
analyzed: caritvānaḥ idha āgate
translated: and have now come here,

original: Te aññe atirocanti,
analyzed: te aññe atirocanti
translated: Surpassing the other gods

original: vaṇṇena yasasāyunā;
analyzed: vaṇṇena yasasā āyunā
translated: in beauty, glory, and life-span,

original: Sāvakā bhūripaññassa,
analyzed: sāvakāḥ bhūripaññassa
translated: The disciples of the One of Great Wisdom,

original: visesūpagatā idha.
analyzed: visesu upagatāḥ idha
translated: have come to a special status here.

original: Idaṁ disvāna nandanti,🔽tāvatiṁsā sahindakā;🔽Tathāgataṁ namassantā,
analyzed: idam disvāna nandanti  tāvatī sā sahindakā  tathāgatam namassantā
translated: Seeing this, the Thirty-Three Gods, together with their lord,🔽rejoice and are glad,

original: dhammassa ca sudhammatan’ti.
analyzed: dhammassa ca su dhamma tanti
translated: and they pay homage to the Realised One and the Dhamma’s good teaching.’

original: Tena sudaṁ, bhante, devā tāvatiṁsā bhiyyoso mattāya attamanā honti pamuditā pītisomanassajātā;
analyzed: tena suda bhante devā tāvatisā bhiyyosas mattāya attamanā honti pamuditā pīti somanassa jātā
translated: Then, reverend Sir, the Thirty-Three Gods are even more uplifted and glad, joyful and happy,

original: ‘dibbā vata bho, kāyā paripūrenti, hāyanti asurakāyā’ti.
analyzed: dibbā vata bho kāyā paripūrenti hāyanti asura kāyā ati
translated: (thinking): ‘The divine hosts are increasing, the hosts of the Asuras are decreasing.’

original: 2. Aṭṭhayathābhuccavaṇṇa
analyzed: aṭṭha yathā bhucca vaṇṇa
translated: . The Eight True Facts about the Realised One

original: Atha kho, bhante, sakko devānamindo devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ sampasādaṁ viditvā deve tāvatiṁse āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhante sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ devānam sampasādam viditvā deve tāvatise āmantesi
translated: Then, reverend Sir, Sakka, having understood the delight of the Thirty-Three Gods, addressed the Thirty-Three Gods, (saying):

original: ‘iccheyyātha no tumhe, mārisā, tassa bhagavato aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe sotun’ti?
analyzed: iccheyyātha no tumhe mārisā tassa bhagavataḥ yathābhucce vaṇṇe sotunti
translated: ‘Would you, dear Sirs, like to hear the eight true facts about the Realised One?’

original: ‘Icchāma mayaṁ, mārisa, tassa bhagavato aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe sotun’ti.
analyzed: icchāma maya mārisa tassa bhagavato yathābhucce vaṇṇe sotunti
translated: ‘We would like to hear the eight true facts about the Realised One, dear Sir.’

original: Atha kho, bhante, sakko devānamindo devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ bhagavato aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe payirudāhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho bhante sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ devānam tāvatisānam bhagavataḥ aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe payirudāhāsi
translated: Then, reverend Sir, Sakka, having understood the delight of the Thirty-Three Gods, recited the eight true facts about the Realised One to the Thirty-Three Gods, (saying):

original: ‘Taṁ kiṁ maññanti, bhonto devā tāvatiṁsā?
analyzed: tam kim maññanti bhontaḥ devā tāvatisā
translated: ‘What do you think, dear Sirs, of the Thirty-Three Gods?

original: Yāvañca so bhagavā bahujanahitāya paṭipanno bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: yāvat ca saḥ bhagavā bahu jana hitāya paṭipannaḥ bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: How far the Blessed One is engaged in the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and humans!

original: Evaṁ bahujanahitāya paṭipannaṁ bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya
analyzed: evam bahu jana hitāya paṭipannam bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya
translated: He practices for the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, for the good, welfare, and happiness of many people, for the sake of heaven, for the sake of what is wholesome, for the sake of the welfare of devas and human beings.

original: devamanussānaṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na🔽panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: deva manussānam iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na  pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: I do not see any other single teacher in the world—whether presently living or already deceased, whether renowned or unrenowned—

original: Svākkhāto kho pana tena bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhi.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ kho pana tena bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi
translated: whose doctrine is as well expounded, as clear, as open, as free from subjectivism, as leading onward as this one.🔽I do not see any other single teacher in the world—whether presently living or already deceased, whether renowned or unrenowned—

original: Evaṁ opaneyyikassa dhammassa desetāraṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam opaneyyikassa dhammassa desetāram iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: whose doctrine is as well expounded, as clear, as open, as free from subjectivism, as leading onward as this one.

original: “Idaṁ kusalan”ti kho pana tena bhagavatā supaññattaṁ, “idaṁ akusalan”ti supaññattaṁ.
analyzed: idam kusalanti kho pana tena bhagavatā su paññattaḥ idam akusalanti su paññatta
translated: “This is wholesome,” has been well expounded by the Blessed One, and “this is unwholesome” has been well expounded by the Blessed One.

original: “Idaṁ sāvajjaṁ idaṁ anavajjaṁ, idaṁ sevitabbaṁ idaṁ na sevitabbaṁ, idaṁ hīnaṁ idaṁ paṇītaṁ, idaṁ kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgan”ti supaññattaṁ.
analyzed: idam sāvajjam idam anavajje idam sevitabbam idam na sevitabbe idam hīnam idam paṇīte idam kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāgam ti su paññatta
translated: we have seen no other ascetic or brahmin…

original: Evaṁ kusalākusalasāvajjānavajjasevitabbāsevitabbahīnapaṇītakaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgānaṁ🔽dhammānaṁ paññāpetāraṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma,🔽na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam kusala akusala sāvajja anavajja sevitabba asevitabba hīna paṇīta kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāgāna  dhammānam paññāpetāram iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma  na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: who is so skilled in the various diverse views as is the Lord.

original: Supaññattā kho pana tena bhagavatā sāvakānaṁ nibbānagāminī paṭipadā, saṁsandati nibbānañca paṭipadā ca.
analyzed: su paññattā kho pana tena bhagavatā sāvakānam nibbāna gāminī paṭipadā sasandati nibbānam ca paṭipadā ca
translated: And the way leading to Nibbana has been well proclaimed by the Lord to his disciples, so that by practising in accordance with it they may attain the company of those who have attained to the supreme goal, and so that they may realise for themselves by direct knowledge the supreme goal of the spiritual life, for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma gaṅgodakaṁ yamunodakena saṁsandati sameti;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma gaṅgā udakam yamunā udakena sasandati sameti
translated: Just as the river Ganges flows to the east, has an easterly slope, flows easterly, and tends to the east,

original: evameva supaññattā tena bhagavatā sāvakānaṁ nibbānagāminī paṭipadā, saṁsandati nibbānañca paṭipadā ca.
analyzed: evam eva su paññattā tena bhagavatā sāvakānam nibbāna gāminī paṭipadā sasandati nibbānam ca paṭipadā ca
translated: so too, the way leading to Nibbana has been well proclaimed by the Lord to his disciples, so that by practising in accordance with it they may attain to the company of those who have attained to the supreme goal, and so that they may realise for themselves by direct knowledge the supreme goal of the spiritual life, for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Evaṁ nibbānagāminiyā paṭipadāya paññāpetāraṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam nibbāna gāminiyā paṭipadāya paññāpetāram iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: I do not see that in the past there was ever a teacher who had a more purified livelihood than the Blessed One.

original: Abhinipphanno kho pana tassa bhagavato lābho abhinipphanno siloko, yāva maññe khattiyā sampiyāyamānarūpā viharanti, vigatamado kho pana so bhagavā āhāraṁ āhāreti.
analyzed: abhinipphannaḥ kho pana tassa bhagavataḥ lābhaḥ abhinipphannaḥ si lokaḥ yāva maññe khattiyā sampiyāyamāna rūpā viharanti vigata madaḥ kho pana saḥ bhagavā āhāram āhāreti
translated: The Blessed One’s gains and fame have increased, and it seems that the nobles are living with him in a spirit of cooperation and freedom from worry.

original: Evaṁ vigatamadaṁ āhāraṁ āharayamānaṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam vigata madam āhāram āharayamānam iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: I do not see that in the past there was ever a teacher who had a more purified livelihood than the Blessed One.

original: Laddhasahāyo kho pana so bhagavā sekhānañceva paṭipannānaṁ khīṇāsavānañca vusitavataṁ.
analyzed: laddha sahāyaḥ khalu pana saḥ bhagavā sekhānam ca iva paṭipannānam khīṇāsavānam ca
translated: The Blessed One has a companion in the higher virtue of those in training and in the higher virtue of those beyond training who are still subject to lapses.

original: Te bhagavā apanujja ekārāmataṁ anuyutto viharati.
analyzed: te bhagavā apanujje eka ārāmatam anuyuttaḥ viharati
translated: The Blessed One has abandoned the companion and lives secluded.

original: Evaṁ ekārāmataṁ anuyuttaṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam eka ārāmatam anuyuttam iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: anyone who is so devoted to solitude as the Blessed One is.

original: Yathāvādī kho pana so bhagavā tathākārī, yathākārī tathāvādī, iti yathāvādī tathākārī, yathākārī tathāvādī.
analyzed: yathāvādī kho pana saḥ bhagavā tathākārī yathākārī tathāvādī iti yathāvādī tathākārī yathākārī tathāvādī
translated: “The Blessed One is one who acts in accordance with what he teaches and teaches in accordance with what he does.🔽I do not see that in the past or the present

original: Evaṁ dhammānudhammappaṭipannaṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam dhamma anudhamma paṭipannam iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: anyone who practices in accordance with the Dhamma as the Blessed One does.

original: Tiṇṇavicikiccho kho pana so bhagavā vigatakathaṅkatho pariyositasaṅkappo ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyaṁ.
analyzed: tiṇṇa vicikicchaḥ kho pana so bhagavā vigata kathaṅkatho pariyosita saṅkappaḥ ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariya
translated: “The Blessed One has crossed over doubt, gotten rid of indecision, and is no longer perplexed about the true Dhamma.

original: Evaṁ tiṇṇavicikicchaṁ vigatakathaṅkathaṁ pariyositasaṅkappaṁ ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyaṁ
analyzed: evam tiṇṇa vicikiccham vigata kathaṅkatham pariyosita saṅkappam ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariya
translated: I do not see that in the past or the present🔽anyone who has crossed over doubt as the Blessed One has.🔽“The Blessed One has fulfilled the holy life,🔽I do not see that in the past or the present

original: imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā’ti.
analyzed: iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā ati
translated: anyone who has fulfilled the holy life as the Blessed One has.”

original: Ime kho, bhante, sakko devānamindo devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ bhagavato aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe payirudāhāsi.
analyzed: ime kho bhante sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ devānam bhagavataḥ aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe
translated: This is how Sakka, ruler of the gods, expressed his appreciation for the eight amazing and wonderful qualities of the Buddha.

original: Tena sudaṁ, bhante, devā tāvatiṁsā bhiyyoso mattāya attamanā honti pamuditā pītisomanassajātā bhagavato aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe sutvā.
analyzed: tena suda bhante devā tāvatisāḥ bhiyyosaḥ mattāya attamanāḥ honti pamuditā pīti somanassa jātā bhagavataḥ aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe sutvā
translated: And the gods of the Thirty-three were satisfied and delighted in the Buddha’s words.

translated: thinking: ‘We will find out what this light means. We will find out what this radiance means.’

analyzed: pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: I do not see any teacher who goes further in these things than the Lord.

original: Svākkhāto kho pana tena bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhi.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ kho pana tena bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi
translated: And the Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Lord, visible here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, leading onward, to be realised by the wise each one for himself.

original: Evaṁ opaneyyikassa dhammassa desetāraṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam opaneyyikassa dhammassa desetāram iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: I do not see any other ascetic or brahmin—in this present generation, with its devas, māras and Brahmās, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans—who explains the Dhamma in such a way that the one who practices it will quickly enter and dwell in this supreme goal of the holy life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: “Idaṁ kusalan”ti kho pana tena bhagavatā supaññattaṁ, “idaṁ akusalan”ti supaññattaṁ,
analyzed: idam kusalanti kho pana tena bhagavatā su paññattaḥ idam akusalanti su paññatta
translated: “This is wholesome,” has been well-proclaimed by the Blessed One; “this is unwholesome” has been well-proclaimed;

original: “idaṁ sāvajjaṁ idaṁ anavajjaṁ, idaṁ sevitabbaṁ idaṁ na sevitabbaṁ, idaṁ hīnaṁ idaṁ🔽paṇītaṁ, idaṁ kaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgan”ti supaññattaṁ.🔽Evaṁ kusalākusalasāvajjānavajjasevitabbāsevitabbahīnapaṇītakaṇhasukkasappaṭibhāgānaṁ dhammānaṁ paññāpetāraṁ.
analyzed: idam sāvajjam idam anavajjaḥ idam sevitabbam idam na sevitabbaḥ idam hīnam  paṇīte idam kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāganti su paññatta  evam kusala akusala sāvajja anavajja sevitabba asevitabba hīna paṇīta kaṇha sukka sappaṭibhāgānam dhammānam paññāpetāra
translated: “this is blameworthy,” “this is blameless,” “this should be cultivated,” “this should not be cultivated,” “this is inferior,” “this is excellent,” “this is diverse,” “this is a good practice,” “this is a bad practice,” “this is not the Dhamma,” “this is not the Discipline,” “this is not the Teacher’s instruction”—has been well-proclaimed.

original: Imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: I do not see any other ascetic or brahmin—in this present generation, with its devas, māras and Brahmās, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans—who explains the Dhamma in such a way that the one who practices it will quickly enter and dwell in this supreme goal of the holy life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Supaññattā kho pana tena bhagavatā sāvakānaṁ nibbānagāminī paṭipadā saṁsandati nibbānañca paṭipadā ca.
analyzed: su paññattā kho pana tena bhagavatā sāvakānam nibbāna gāminī paṭipadā sasandati nibbānam ca paṭipadā ca
translated: The Blessed One has well-proclaimed the way that accords with the goal, and the goal that accords with the way.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma gaṅgodakaṁ yamunodakena saṁsandati sameti;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma gaṅgā udakam yamunā udakena sasandati sameti
translated: Just as the waters of the Ganges and the waters of the Yamunā mingle and flow together into the great ocean,

original: evameva supaññattā tena bhagavatā sāvakānaṁ nibbānagāminī paṭipadā saṁsandati nibbānañca paṭipadā ca.
analyzed: evam eva su paññattā tena bhagavatā sāvakānam nibbāna gāminī paṭipadā sasandati nibbānam ca paṭipadā ca
translated: so too does the well-expounded practice that leads to Nibbana mingle with Nibbana.

original: Evaṁ nibbānagāminiyā paṭipadāya paññāpetāraṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam nibbāna gāminiyā paṭipadāya paññāpetāram iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: I do not see any other teacher in the world—whether presently living or already deceased—who has so well expounded a practice that leads to Nibbana, except the Blessed One.

original: Abhinipphanno kho pana tassa bhagavato lābho abhinipphanno siloko, yāva maññe khattiyā sampiyāyamānarūpā viharanti.
analyzed: abhinipphannaḥ kho pana tassa bhagavataḥ lābhaḥ abhinipphannaḥ si lokaḥ yāva maññe khattiyā sampiyāyamāna rūpā viharanti
translated: The Blessed One’s gains and fame have increased. It seems that the nobles are living with him in a state of intimacy.

original: Vigatamado kho pana so bhagavā āhāraṁ āhāreti.
analyzed: vigata madaḥ khalu pana saḥ bhagavā āhāram āhāra iti
translated: The Blessed One eats his food without excitement.

original: Evaṁ vigatamadaṁ āhāraṁ āharayamānaṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam vigata madam āhāram āharayamānam iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: I do not see any other teacher in the world—whether presently living or already deceased—who eats his food without excitement, except the Blessed One.

original: Laddhasahāyo kho pana so bhagavā sekhānañceva paṭipannānaṁ khīṇāsavānañca vusitavataṁ, te bhagavā apanujja ekārāmataṁ anuyutto viharati.
analyzed: laddha sahāyaḥ kho pana saḥ bhagavā sekhānam ca iva paṭipannānam khīṇāsavānam ca te bhagavā apanujje eka ārāmatam anuyuttaḥ viharati
translated: And the Blessed One has a companion in the higher virtue of those still in training, and in the fulfilled virtue of those beyond training. The Blessed One, having abandoned that companion, lives secluded.

original: Evaṁ ekārāmataṁ anuyuttaṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam eka ārāmatam anuyuttam iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: We do not find any other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose higher virtue of those still in training and fulfilled virtue of those beyond training is like that of the Blessed One’s, let alone greater.

original: Yathāvādī kho pana so bhagavā tathākārī, yathākārī tathāvādī;
analyzed: yathāvādī kho pana saḥ bhagavā tathākārī yathākārī tathāvādī
translated: As the Blessed One speaks, so he does; as he does, so he speaks.

original: iti yathāvādī tathākārī, yathākārī tathāvādī.
analyzed: iti yathāvādī tathākārī yathākārī tathāvādī
translated: Thus he is as he speaks and speaks as he is.

original: Evaṁ dhammānudhammappaṭippannaṁ imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā.
analyzed: evam dhamma anudhamma paṭippannam iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā
translated: We do not find any other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose higher virtue of those still in training and fulfilled virtue of those beyond training is like that of the Blessed One’s, let alone greater.

original: Tiṇṇavicikiccho kho pana so bhagavā vigatakathaṅkatho pariyositasaṅkappo ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyaṁ.
analyzed: tiṇṇa vicikicchaḥ kho pana so bhagavā vigata kathaṅkatho pariyosita saṅkappaḥ ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariya
translated: The Blessed One is free from doubt, uncertainty, and wavering with regard to the enlightenment of the Buddha.

original: Evaṁ tiṇṇavicikicchaṁ vigatakathaṅkathaṁ pariyositasaṅkappaṁ ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyaṁ.
analyzed: evam tiṇṇa vicikiccham vigata kathaṅkatham pariyosita saṅkappam ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariya
translated: Thus he has crossed over doubt and gotten rid of indecision, has done with sus­pecting and doubting with regard to wholesome qualities, and has no more perplexity.

original: Imināpaṅgena samannāgataṁ satthāraṁ neva atītaṁse samanupassāma, na panetarahi, aññatra tena bhagavatā’ti.🔽Ime kho, bhante, sakko devānamindo brahmuno sanaṅkumārassa bhagavato aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe payirudāhāsi.🔽Tena sudaṁ, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro attamano hoti pamudito pītisomanassajāto bhagavato aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe sutvā.
analyzed: iminā apaṅgena samannāgatam satthāram na iva atītase samanupassāma na pana itarahi aññatra tena bhagavatā ati  ime kho bhante sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ brahmunaḥ sanaṅkumārassa bhagavataḥ aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe payirudāhāsi  tena suda bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ atta manaḥ hoti pamuditaḥ pīti somanassa jātaḥ bhagavataḥ aṭṭha yathābhucce vaṇṇe sutvā
translated: We do not find a teacher endowed with these ten qualities, either now or in the future.🔽This is how Sakka praised the Blessed One with fitting and true p­raise.🔽And when the Blessed One had been praised by Sakka, king of the gods, with fitting and true p­raise, he then uttered this verse:

original: Atha, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro oḷārikaṁ attabhāvaṁ abhinimminitvā kumāravaṇṇī hutvā pañcasikho devānaṁ tāvatiṁsānaṁ pāturahosi.
analyzed: atha bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ oḷārikam atta bhāvam abhinimminitvā kumāravaṇṇī hutvā pañcasikhaḥ devānam tāvatisānam
translated: Then Sakka, ruler of gods, having assumed a form of such magnificence, appeared in the sky above the Thirty-Three.

original: So vehāsaṁ abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena nisīdi.
analyzed: saḥ vehāsam abbhut gantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena nisīdi
translated: Rising up into the sky, he sat cross-legged in the air.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante, balavā puriso supaccatthate vā pallaṅke same vā bhūmibhāge pallaṅkena nisīdeyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api bhante balavā purisaḥ su paccatthate vā pallaṅke same vā bhūmi bhāge pallaṅkena nisīdeyya
translated: Just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm,

original: evameva kho, bhante, brahmā sanaṅkumāro vehāsaṁ abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena nisīditvā deve tāvatiṁse āmantesi:
analyzed: evam eva khalu bhante brahmā sanaṅkumāraḥ vehāsam abbhut gantvā ākāse antalikkhe pallaṅkena nisīditvā deve tāvatise āmantesi
translated: so too did Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra vanish from the Brahmā-world and reappear in front of the Thirty-Three Gods, sitting cross-legged in the air.

original: 5. Govindabrāhmaṇavatthu
analyzed: govindabrāhmaṇavatthu
translated: The Story of the Brahmin Govinda

original: ‘Taṁ kiṁ maññanti, bhonto devā tāvatiṁsā, yāva dīgharattaṁ mahāpaññova so bhagavā ahosi.
analyzed: tam kim maññanti bhontaḥ devā tāvatisā yāva dīgharattam mahā paññā uva saḥ bhagavā ahosi
translated: ‘What do you think, gentlemen? For a long time the Blessed One has been one of great wisdom.

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bho, rājā disampati nāma ahosi.
analyzed: bhūta pubba bho rājā disampati nāma ahosi
translated: Once upon a time, gentlemen, there was a king called Disampati.

original: Disampatissa rañño govindo nāma brāhmaṇo purohito ahosi.
analyzed: disampatissa raññaḥ govindaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ purohitaḥ ahosi
translated: The king Disampati had a chaplain called Govinda.

original: Disampatissa rañño reṇu nāma kumāro putto ahosi.
analyzed: disampatissa raññaḥ reṇu nāma kumāro putto ahosi
translated: The king Disampati had a son called Prince Renu.

original: Govindassa brāhmaṇassa jotipālo nāma māṇavo putto ahosi.
analyzed: govindassa brāhmaṇassa jotipālaḥ nāma māṇavo putto ahosi
translated: The brahmin Govinda had a son called Jotipala.

original: Iti reṇu ca rājaputto jotipālo ca māṇavo aññe ca cha khattiyā iccete aṭṭha sahāyā ahesuṁ.
analyzed: iti reṇu ca rājaputto jotipālo ca māṇavaḥ aññe ca cha khattiyāḥ icca ete aṭṭha sahāyāḥ ahesu
translated: So Prince Renu, Jotipala, and six other nobles were eight friends.

original: Atha kho, bho, ahorattānaṁ accayena govindo brāhmaṇo kālamakāsi.
analyzed: atha kho bho ahorattānam accayena govindaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ kālam akāsi
translated: And after a night and day had passed, the brahmin Govinda died.

original: Govinde brāhmaṇe kālaṅkate rājā disampati paridevesi:🔽“yasmiṁ vata, bho, mayaṁ samaye govinde brāhmaṇe sabbakiccāni sammā vossajjitvā pañcahi
analyzed: govinde brāhmaṇe kālaṅkate rājā disampati paridevesi  yasmin vata bho mayam samaye govinde brāhmaṇe sabba kiccāni sammā vossajjitvā pañcahi
translated: When the brahmin Govinda had died, King Disampati lamented:

original: kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricārema, tasmiṁ no samaye govindo brāhmaṇo kālaṅkato”ti.
analyzed: kāma guṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricārema tasmin no samaye govindaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: “At the very time when we had entrusted all our duties to the brahmin Govinda and were enjoying ourselves provided and endowed with the five cords of sensual pleasure, at that very time the brahmin Govinda died.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, bho, reṇu rājaputto rājānaṁ disampatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bho reṇu rāja puttaḥ rājānam disampatim etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the prince Renu replied:

original: “mā kho tvaṁ, deva, govinde brāhmaṇe kālaṅkate atibāḷhaṁ paridevesi.
analyzed: mā kho tva deva govinde brāhmaṇe kālaṅkate ati bāḷham paridevesi
translated: “Sire, do not lament too much over the death of the brahmin Govinda.

original: Atthi, deva, govindassa brāhmaṇassa jotipālo nāma māṇavo putto paṇḍitataro ceva pitarā, alamatthadasataro ceva pitarā;
analyzed: atthi deva govindassa brāhmaṇassa jotipālaḥ nāma māṇavaḥ putto paṇḍitataraḥ ca iva pitarā alamattha dasataraḥ ca iva pitarā
translated: Sire, the brahmin Govinda had a son named Jotipala, who is cleverer and wiser than his father.

original: yepissa pitā atthe anusāsi, tepi jotipālasseva māṇavassa anusāsaniyā”ti.
analyzed: ye pi ssa pitā atthe anusāsi te pi jotipālassa iva māṇavassa anusāsaniyā ati
translated: Whatever his father advised him about, he did it.”

original: “Evaṁ, kumārā”ti?
analyzed: eva kumāra ati
translated: “Is that so, prince?”

original: “Evaṁ, devā”ti.
analyzed: eva deva ati
translated: “Yes, sire.”

original: 6. Mahāgovindavatthu
translated: The Story of Mahāgovinda

original: Atha kho, bho, rājā disampati aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:🔽“ehi tvaṁ, ambho purisa, yena jotipālo māṇavo tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā jotipālaṁ māṇavaṁ evaṁ vadehi:
analyzed: atha kho bho rājā disampati aññataram purisam āmantesi  ehi tva ambho purisa yena jotipālaḥ māṇavaḥ tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā jotipālam māṇavam evam vadehi
translated: Then King Disampati addressed a certain man, saying:🔽“Come here, good man, go to the student Jotipala and say to him:🔽‘Master Jotipala, King Disampati summons you.’

original: ‘bhavamatthu bhavantaṁ jotipālaṁ, rājā disampati bhavantaṁ jotipālaṁ māṇavaṁ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo’”ti.
analyzed: bhavamatthu bhavantam jotipāla rājā disampati bhavantam jotipālam māṇavam āmantayati rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassana kāmo ti
translated: Then King Disampati told a man, ‘Come, good man, go to the brahmin student Jotipala and say to him: “May the venerable Jotipala be well! King Disampati calls the venerable Jotipala to come, the king wishes to see the venerable Jotipala.”‘

original: “Evaṁ, devā”ti kho, bho, so puriso disampatissa rañño paṭissutvā yena jotipālo māṇavo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā jotipālaṁ māṇavaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: eva deva iti kho bho so purisaḥ disampatissa rañño paṭissutvā yena jotipālaḥ māṇavo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā jotipālam māṇavam etat avoca
translated: ‘Yes, sire,’ the man replied, and he went to the brahmin student Jotipala and told him:

original: “bhavamatthu bhavantaṁ jotipālaṁ, rājā disampati bhavantaṁ jotipālaṁ māṇavaṁ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo”ti.
analyzed: bhavamatthu bhavantam jotipāla rājā disampati bhavantam jotipālam māṇavam āmantayati rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassana kāmo ti
translated: ‘May the venerable Jotipala be well! King Disampati calls the venerable Jotipala to come, the king wishes to see the venerable Jotipala.’

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho, bho, jotipālo māṇavo tassa purisassa paṭissutvā yena rājā disampati tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā disampatinā raññā saddhiṁ sammodi;
analyzed: eva bhoti kho bho jotipālaḥ māṇavo tassa purisassa paṭissutvā yena rājā disampati tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā disampatinā raññā saddhim sammodi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Jotipala replied. He went to King Disampati, exchanged pleasant greetings with him,

original: sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho, bho, jotipālaṁ māṇavaṁ rājā disampati etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam kho bho jotipālam māṇavam rājā disampati etat avoca
translated: and sat down to one side. The king said to him:

original: “anusāsatu no bhavaṁ jotipālo, mā no bhavaṁ jotipālo anusāsaniyā paccabyāhāsi.
analyzed: anusāsatu naḥ bhavam joti pālaḥ mā naḥ bhavam joti pālaḥ anusāsaniyā paccabyāhāsi
translated: “Advise me, Master Jotipala, and do not refuse.

original: Pettike taṁ ṭhāne ṭhapessāmi, govindiye abhisiñcissāmī”ti.🔽“Evaṁ, bho”ti kho, bho, so jotipālo māṇavo disampatissa rañño paccassosi.
analyzed: pettike tam ṭhāne ṭhapessāmi govindiye abhisiñcissāmi iti  eva bhoti kho bho so jotipālaḥ māṇavaḥ disampatissa rañño paccassosi
translated: I will establish you in the place of my father, and anoint you as my heir.”🔽“Yes, sir,” Jotipala replied.

original: Atha kho, bho, rājā disampati jotipālaṁ māṇavaṁ govindiye abhisiñci, taṁ pettike ṭhāne ṭhapesi.
analyzed: atha khalu bho rājā disampati jotipālam māṇavam govindiye abhisiñci tam pettike ṭhāne ṭhapesi
translated: And King Disampati anointed Jotipala as his heir and established him in the place of his father.

original: Abhisitto jotipālo māṇavo govindiye pettike ṭhāne ṭhapito yepissa pitā atthe anusāsi tepi atthe anusāsati, yepissa pitā atthe nānusāsi tepi atthe anusāsati;
analyzed: abhisittaḥ jotipālaḥ māṇavaḥ govindiye pettike ṭhāne ṭhapitaḥ ye pissa pitā atthe anusāsi te api atthe anusāsati ye pissa pitā atthe na anusāsi te api atthe anusāsati
translated: The young brahmin Jotipāla was consecrated as the brahmin Govinda’s heir. He advised him about the same matters his father had advised him about, and about some he did not advise him.

original: yepissa pitā kammante abhisambhosi tepi kammante abhisambhoti, yepissa pitā kammante nābhisambhosi tepi kammante abhisambhoti.
analyzed: ye pissa pitā kammante abhisambhosi te api kammante abhisambhoti ye pissa pitā kammante na abhisambhosi te pi kammante abhisambhoti
translated: He succeeded in the same matters his father had succeeded in, and in some he did not succeed.

original: Tamenaṁ manussā evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: tam enam manussāḥ evam āhasu
translated: People said:

original: “govindo vata, bho, brāhmaṇo, mahāgovindo vata, bho, brāhmaṇo”ti.
analyzed: govindaḥ vata bho brāhmaṇaḥ mahāgovindaḥ vata bho brāhmaṇa uti
translated: “The brahmin Govinda is indeed a great brahmin!”

original: abyāpajjena pharitvā vihāsi.🔽Karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
analyzed: a byāpajjena vihāsi  karuṇā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: he abided pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.🔽With a mind imbued with compassion …

original: muditāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
analyzed: muditā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: with a mind imbued with sympathetic joy …🔽with a mind imbued with equanimity …

original: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā …pe… abyāpajjena pharitvā vihāsi.
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatena cetasā pe a byāpajjena pharitvā vihāsi
translated: he abided pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with equanimity, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: Sāvakānañca brahmalokasahabyatāya maggaṁ desesi.🔽Ye kho pana, bho, tena samayena mahāgovindassa brāhmaṇassa sāvakā sabbenasabbaṁ sāsanaṁ ājāniṁsu.
analyzed: sāvakānam ca brahma loka sahabya tāya maggam desesi  ye kho pana bho tena samayena mahāgovindassa brāhmaṇassa sāvakā sabbena sabbam sāsanam
translated: And he taught the path to union with the Brahma-world to his disciples.🔽And those disciples of his who had completely mastered his teachings

original: Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ brahmalokaṁ upapajjiṁsu.
analyzed: te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim brahma lokam upapajjisu
translated: after the breakup of the body, upon the cessation of life, arose in a good destination, in the heavenly world in the company of the Brahma gods.

original: Ye na sabbenasabbaṁ sāsanaṁ ājāniṁsu, te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā appekacce paranimmitavasavattīnaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjiṁsu;
analyzed: ye na sabbena sabbam sāsanam ājānisu te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā appa ekacce paranimmitavasavattīnam devānam sahabyatam upapajjisu
translated: But those who had not completely mastered his teachings after the breakup of the body, upon the cessation of life, some arose in the company of the Aviha gods;

original: appekacce nimmānaratīnaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjiṁsu;
analyzed: appekacce nimmāna ratīnam devānam sahabyatam upapajjisu
translated: some were reborn in the company of the gods who delight in creation,

original: appekacce tusitānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjiṁsu;🔽appekacce yāmānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjiṁsu;🔽appekacce tāvatiṁsānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjiṁsu;
analyzed: appekacce tusitānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjisu  appekacce yāmānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjisu  appekacce devānam sahabyatam upapajjisu
translated: some were reborn in the company of the gods who wield power over others’ creations,🔽some were reborn in the company of the Yama gods,🔽some were reborn in the company of the gods of the Thirty-three,

original: appekacce cātumahārājikānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjiṁsu;
analyzed: appa ekacce cātumahārājikānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjisu
translated: some were reborn in the company of the gods of the Four Great Kings,

original: ye sabbanihīnaṁ kāyaṁ paripūresuṁ te gandhabbakāyaṁ paripūresuṁ.
analyzed: ye sabba nihīnam kāyam paripūresum te gandhabba kāyam paripūresu
translated: and those who filled the lowest bodies filled the bodies of the gandhabbas.

original: Iti kho, bho, sabbesaṁyeva tesaṁ kulaputtānaṁ amoghā pabbajjā ahosi avañjhā saphalā saudrayā’ti.
analyzed: iti kho bho sabbesayā iva tesam kula puttānam amoghā pabbajjā ahosi avañjhā saphalā
translated: So, sirs, the going forth of all those gentlemen was not wasted, not fruitless, not without result, it had a great reward and a great outcome.’

original: Sarati taṁ bhagavā”ti?
analyzed: sarati tam bhagavān ati
translated: Do you remember that, Lord?”

original: “Sarāmahaṁ, pañcasikha.
analyzed: sarāmaha pañcasikha
translated: “I remember it, Pañcasikha.

original: Ahaṁ tena samayena mahāgovindo brāhmaṇo ahosiṁ.
analyzed: aham tena samayena mahāgovindaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: At that time I was the Great Steward.

original: Ahaṁ tesaṁ sāvakānaṁ brahmalokasahabyatāya maggaṁ desesiṁ.
analyzed: aham tesam sāvakānam brahma loka sahabya tāya maggam desesi
translated: I taught those disciples the path to rebirth in the company of the Brahmā gods.

original: Taṁ kho pana me, pañcasikha, brahmacariyaṁ na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṁvattati, yāvadeva brahmalokūpapattiyā.
analyzed: tam kho pana me pañcasikha brahmacariyam na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya savattati yāvat eva brahma loka upapattiyā
translated: But that spiritual life did not lead to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbana, but only to rebirth in the Brahma-world.

original: Idaṁ kho pana me, pañcasikha, brahmacariyaṁ ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: idam kho pana me pañcasikha brahmacariyam ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: But this spiritual life that I now live is one that leads to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbana.

original: Katamañca taṁ, pañcasikha, brahmacariyaṁ ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati?🔽Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo.
analyzed: kataman ca ta pañcasikha brahmacariyam ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati  ayam eva ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo
translated: And what, Pansukula, is that spiritual life that leads to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbana?

original: Seyyathidaṁ—sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
analyzed: seyyathida sammā diṭṭhi sammā saṅkappo sammā vācā sammā kammanto sammā ājīvaḥ sammā vāyāmaḥ sammā sati sammā samādhi
translated: It is this Noble Eightfold Path; right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration.

original: Idaṁ kho taṁ, pañcasikha, brahmacariyaṁ ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.🔽Ye kho pana me, pañcasikha, sāvakā sabbenasabbaṁ sāsanaṁ ājānanti, te āsavānaṁ khayā
analyzed: idam kho ta pañcasikha brahmacariyam ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati  ye kho pana me pañcasikha sāvakā sabbenasabbam sāsanam ājānanti te āsavānam khayā
translated: This holy life, Pancasikha, leads to complete disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbana.

original: anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharanti;🔽ye na sabbenasabbaṁ sāsanaṁ ājānanti, te pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātikā honti tattha parinibbāyino anāvattidhammā tasmā lokā.
analyzed: anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharanti  ye na sabbena sabbam sāsanam ājānanti te pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikāḥ honti tattha parinibbāyinaḥ an āvatti dhammā tasmā lokāḥ
translated: “Those disciples of mine, Pancasikha, who understand my teaching entirely will, by the destruction of the taints, in this very life realize for themselves with direct knowledge the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, and having entered upon it, will dwell in it.🔽“Those disciples of mine, Pancasikha, who do not understand my teaching entirely will, by the destruction of the five lower fetters, become due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana, without ever returning from that world.

original: Ye na sabbenasabbaṁ sāsanaṁ ājānanti, appekacce tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṁ tanuttā sakadāgāmino honti sakideva imaṁ lokaṁ āgantvā dukkhassantaṁ karissanti.
analyzed: ye na sabbena sabbam sāsanam ājānanti appa ekacce tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayāḥ rāga dosa mohānam tanuttā sakadāgāminaḥ honti sakideva imam lokam āgantvā dukkha ssantam karissanti
translated: “Those disciples of mine, Pancasikha, who do not understand my teaching entirely will, by the destruction of three fetters and the reduction of greed, hatred, and delusion, become once-returners, returning once to this world to make an end of suffering.

original: Ye na sabbenasabbaṁ sāsanaṁ ājānanti, appekacce tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpannā honti avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā.
analyzed: ye na sabbena sabbam sāsanam ājānanti appa ekacce tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā sotāpannāḥ honti a vinipāta dhammāḥ niyatāḥ sambodhi parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Those who do not understand the entire Dispensation have destroyed three fetters and have become stream-enterers, no longer subject to rebirth in lower worlds, headed for enlightenment.

original: Iti kho, pañcasikha, sabbesaṁyeva imesaṁ kulaputtānaṁ amoghā pabbajjā avañjhā saphalā saudrayā”ti.
analyzed: iti kho pañcasikha imesam kula puttānam amoghā pabbajjā avañjhā saphalā
translated: Thus, Pancasikha, the going forth of all these young men is not in vain, not fruitless. It has great fruit and great reward.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This is what the Blessed One said.

original: Attamano pañcasikho gandhabbaputto bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyīti.
analyzed: atta manaḥ pañcasikhaḥ gandhabba puttaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā tattha iva antaradhāyi iti
translated: Pleased, the gandhabba Pancasikha was satisfied with what the Blessed One said.

original: Mahāgovindasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: mahāgovinda suttam niṭṭhitam chaṭṭha
translated: The Sutta on the Great Steward is finished.
